The service is friendly and fast and the place clean. Good for families. The side orders were not as up to par - had the onion rings and fried zucchini - but were not bad. I'd certainly go here again but it isn't "transcendent" where I have to go back immediately.

Thank you goes to two of my co-workers for recommending this hidden gem. I had Jake the snake with Dutch crunch roll bread. Amazingly good!! I can't wait to come back so many choices. I look forward to Ike's sandwiches- by far the best sandwich shop.

Ike's is a fun little sandwich chain in the west.   I was hoping it wasn't a franchise, but it is.  It didn't really change the deliciousness level of the sandwiches, but the price was significantly higher than what I'm used to paying for a sandwich.   Most sandwiches are over $10.  Either way, this place has over 600 options to choose from, funny sandwich names, and a chill college atmosphere.      Pro tip: check in on Yelp and get your free bag of chips!

Absolutely fantastic sandwich! I ordered the mothers day special which was entitled the Cougar. Chicken mozzarella strips Franks hot sauce and ranch dressing served on their eyes were famous Dutch crunch French bread. My son says that there are over 500 sandwiches on the menu but they only list about 50 on their displayed menu.

Love Ike's sandwiches!  Never a complaint there... Too good.

However I have called in and used the order now found on their Yelp Page.  Both times I ordered 30 minutes prior to picking up my food.  Both times, including today, no one started to make my sandwich until I got there.  

I don't understand the reason for the delay, but it can be very frustrating when you want to just pick up and run.  Today I picked up at a slow time at 1:45 and it still wasn't started until I arrived.  Beyond frustrating.

This place is among my favorites as far as sandwich places are concerned. They have about 30+ sandwiches to choose from but you're free to come up with your own combo as well. They have free chips and drinks during happy hour. The only reason I'm giving it a 4 out of 5 stars is because of the music choices, which is primarily rap and hip hop. I really hate to be narrow minded but I'm really not a fan of those genres. With that being said, the music won't deter me from sitting down and shoving a delicious sandwich in my face. My favorite one is the Paul Ruebens with lettuce, tomato and add provolone.

The menu is chaotic but fun, with a multitude of vegetarian options. A little on the pricy side for subs and definitely not worth the price for the sides. The subs themselves are fantastic and whimsical. Leaps and bounds above anything you could get at competitors.

I live in Tucson, but every time I come to Phoenix I make sure to eat at Ike's. The first thing I noticed during my first visit was how extraordinary the service as (and this isn't even a dine-in place). The guy behind the counter greeted us genuinely and everyone else working seemed happy to be there. After we put in our order, we ended up talking to the cashier for like 30 more minutes! Every interaction is genuine and enthusiastic, which is really something unique. 

And goodness...the sandwiches. I was so impressed with how many options there were for people of all different diets. Halal chicken, vegetarian, vegan, and plenty for meat lovers. The options are literally endless. The sandwiches are HUGE and make my heart happy. And to top it off, they give you free caramel apple lollipops! What an awesome little perk.

Overall, if you live in the Phoenix area you MUST try eating here.

They're 5 stars for a reason - great energetic atmosphere, best sandwich in a long, long time! Me and the Mrs.  Paid $4 more for our total meal over what a plain Jane Subw@y meal would have cost - for sandwiches that have FLAVOR and from people that CARE! 

Probably 80 sandwiches to choose from, gluten free if you want, vegan if you want, carnivore if you want. Crunchy Dutch roll-only ones outside of San Francisco  to have them. 

EAT HERE! You won't be disappointed.

Found this hidden gem the week they opened and have been coming back since. Friendly employees, napkin holders that mercilessly flirt with you, sandwiches that are so good you want to lick the paper they came on and atmosphere is adorable!

Today was my husbands and I first time in tempe and we decided to try IKES needless to say we were truly amazed all around the young lady at the cash register provided exceptional customer service and the food alone was fantastic very friendly staff and I would certainly go there again!

Had both Stephan Jenkins and Bear Hug (on separate occasions). These are way too big to eat on your own! High quality meat. Love the pesto and dirty sauce aswell as the many options available. Opened my eyes to a lot of different sammich combinations! Price is alright, but definitely worth it!!!

Just traveling through on our vacation (SF Giants Spring Training) and spotted Ike's.  I know Ike's from the Bay Area, and this did not disappoint.  I got the Vegetarian and my husband got the Menage a Trois with Halal Chicken. Both sandwiches knocked our socks off!  Seriously, how good can a sandwich be?  So good!  Totally recommend.  They obviously take their sandwiches very seriously!  I will always go here when I visit Scottsdale!  (Go Giants!)

My love of Ike's knows no bounds. It is my favorite sandwich place in the country, and I'm so happy we have another location in Arizona. I stopped in the Mill Ave store to get a quick bite before a show at Gammage. I brought my friend who was new to Ike's because I insist on spreading his sandwich gospel.

I decided to get the ASU-exclusive Kate Spade with added avocado. The Sundevil sauce is delicious, kind of a kicky ketchup/BBQ taste. Service was good too.  Our cashier helped my newbie friend navigate the menu with his recommendations. 

Pro tip- Ike's makes a great breakfast the next morning if you pop the 2nd half of your sandwich in a toaster oven for 10-15 minutes.

I still love this place, but they've been out of many food items the last two times I've visited this month. No vegan chicken or meatballs on one visit, and they were out of Dutch Crunch today. That's the highlight of my sandwiches. They also said they were out of onions which is odd. Can't someone make a grocery store run?

I am staying at a hotel close by for a few weeks and tried to come by Ike's about a week ago near lunch time and the place was so busy I didn't have time to wait. 

I made a second attempt and came around 2:30pm and scored a big success. Having a large appetite I went for the Bear Hug. I was drawn to it because one of the ingredients was jalapeño poppers which I am a huge fan of. I took the sandwich to go and ate it at the hotel. I was blow away by all of the amazing flavors and textures rolled into one. It is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had in my life. No joke.

Fantastic product!
Fantastic sub joint on Mill Ave! Highly recommend this place especially if you are comparing it to other sub places. Ike's blows the others out of the water!
BEST SANDWICH EVER! My Matt Cain with jalapeños and banana peppers was delicious. I'll be sure to trek out here sometime for another meal, and I'll be sure to bring anyone I'm with.

A good sandwich is pretty much all about the bread and this place has a great roll.  I tried the Tony Soprano on my first visit.  Anxious to try some others.  Very upbeat vibe.  I'll have to stick with carry-out since they don't serve Coke!

The service is great. The girl at the counter was so excited that it was our first time trying the sandwich and promised that it was going to be the best we ever had. While it was a good sandwich, I can't say it was my favorite. I'm from LA, so we have an abundance of delicious and creative restaurants. However, I think Ike's is a great lunch spot, especially given that they have a vegetarian menu!

Are you super hungry, want to eat something delicious, and just want to feel full and satisfied?! Look no further! These sandwiches will do just that!!!

Tucked away in a small strip right across fiesta mall you will find this yummy sandwich shop. The menu is endless and can be quite overwhelming as there is so much you can choose from. It was our first time there so we took our time and looked over the menu to see exactly what we wanted.

We ended up ordering one number 1/2, (Its the first one on the menu) one number 21, and a number 25. We also got a regular drink and an order of their air fries (employee informed us that the fries are not fried). All the sandwiches do have unique names and a number next to them. You can pick your bread (wheat or sourdough) and they have a vegetarian selection as well. 

Our total was close to $40, and the cashier was nice. 

We sat down and waited about 10 minutes. The employee brought out our food, and was friendly. 

The sandwiches are huge and are cut in half. My sandwich (#25) was amazing! It was turkey, avocado, and bacon on a sourdough bread. They definitely pack your sandwich with a ton of meat and enough veggies. You can add more toppings if you'd like for an additional cost!

I got to try the other sandwiches as well and they were just as delicious as mine was! OMG THE AIR FRIES WERE AMAZING!!! Piping hot and crispy, MMMMM. Will be back soon!

Check in on yelp and get a free bag of chips!

They have a kids menu!

Great atmosphere! Food selection was great. Tons of options and sandwich ideas. Big tip be very careful when selecting add ins they can make your $11 sandwich $18 real quick and grabbing a drink will make it a $20 meal...
Really large menu and amazing yummy large sandwiches - wish I could eat these every day! You should definitely try it if you're reading this and on the fence - worth your time!!!

I have one of these places in California and its fucking flame. I wish I could say the same about the Tempe location. My lettuce tasted old, and my sandwich fell apart. It just wasn't all there, I've had way better sandwiches from Danville CA.

I'm so glad I have family in Arizona for delicious restaurants like Ike's. The Bad Santa is what I order even if it's not in "season." The country fried chicken is breaded and cooked crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside and then condiments bring it all together. Best sandwich!

We stopped by here on the way to our gym. I've only been here a couple times and I can't remember what I ordered in the past. This time I ordered the Tony soprano. The Sandwich comes with salami, ham, turkey, Italian dressing, provolone cheese and it's under nine dollars. We ordered it on the Dutch crunch bread. It was amazingly delicious and comes toasted.  It also comes with their garlic dairy free sauce and is called the dirty sauce, along with lettuce and tomato. We decided to split a sandwich because we didn't want to be too full before working out. It was perfect for two people, we were not starving however and we also got a bag of chips because we checked in through Yelp. They also give you two lollipops for free, cute!

I will not even try to explain the mess that this place is in great detail, and know it was hands down the worst overall experience I have ever had at any food establishment. I will never return.

**I was asked to edit this because of lack of detail. The lady served me a pickle sandwich because she said she could not find the buttons for the five other ingredients that it contained. She said she did not want to bother me with this issue, so just sent me on my way with the pickle sandwich. She offered to remake it when I came back, and the new sandwich was just brown soggy wet veggies with about a cup of hot sauce thrown on it.
I saw all the raves on here and I was like gotta try this place. It didn't do it for me. I think there was to much pesto on my sandwich. Plus it fell apart halfway through.
This place has amazing sandwiches, but when I look at my transaction history to find that my 26 dollar order turned into 48  dollars it makes things bad. Watch your transactions with this place.

Cool sandwiches. Had the Bella and tiffy spiffy. Very filling. Request them to add sriracha on the sandwiches. 
Jalapeño poppers make a good side with the Sandwiches

Great sandwiches and gluten free!   They are great with allergies and have a fun vibe!

The sandwhich was are delicious and the gluten free bread is thick and sturdy- hoagie style.  No crumbly udi's here!  

Order with their online app if you are in a hurry.  

We love it here!   My favorites are the monte chase o and coming home for thanksgiving!

Does Tempe really need another sandwich shop? Well if that sandwich shop is Ike's then yes, yes they do.

Seriously good sandwiches. And one of the largest menu selections I've ever seen.

They have GF bread which is actually pretty good, if a little too large. They're good about CC as I've never been sick after eating here (or the one in Mesa).

Pro Tip: they have a happy hour from 4 - 7 which includes chips and a drink at no extra cost. Plus it's just fun to hear them shout "HAPPY HOUR!"

Literally any kind of sandwich you want; the classics, new twists on old classics, new freakish creations you didn't even know you wanted. Over 200 sandwiches!!! 

2 people with sandwiches, chips and drinks runs about $30. A little spendy, but the quality and taste is well worth it.

Be sure to go between 3-6 to hear them shout "happy hour!" and to get chips and a drink included with your sandwich.

My husband and I went here for lunch one Saturday.  He kept going on about how good it was and I was skeptical at best because I'm not a sandwich person. 

Boy, was I wrong. 

This place is amazing. I'm a picky eater and had a lot of questions. The staff answered them eagerly and happily. I got the number 11 and it was the best sandwich I've ever had. Good food. Place was clean and welcoming. Staff was very helpful and even bagged my stuff up for me when I asked for a box. 

Two thumbs up, will definitely be coming here again!

Ahhhhhhhhhmazing! Headed to the fams for Easter and thought hmmmm a sandwich sounds good. Thanks to yelp we found Ike's !!!! Their signature bread is so delicious as is their special sauce. Tried a roast beef salami one and the deep fried chicken with their BBQ honey sauce. Please start one in Washington. Also the workers were so happy and helpful! Can't wait to come back to Mesa!
Incredible sandwiches! I've tried the Super Mario and the Madison Bumgarner. Both were amazing!
Sandwiches are waaaaaaaaaay over priced and they were nothing special. Plus you gotta drive around for parking. Def rather go to potbelly
Customer service is on point. Best Damn gluten free sub bread I've ever put in my mouth. First time here... definitely coming back and bringing the family with.

Just happened to be driving down the street and saw the goofy advertising of the Mr. Ike dude with his fancy smile and hairdo. Thought I was looking at an old TV commercial of Mr. Clean as a kid. Definitely got my attention and did a quick bookmark for this place.

I'm going to start right off with the fact that these guys make some really good sandwiches. They even make a great Gluten Free version for those who are on a special diet. This is a big reason for me rounding up and going Ape Woohoo on this here review.

Inside is charming with a simple pick what you want and we will make it to your specifications. They have a gigantic menu with a large majority of the sandwiches named after famous celebrities or TV characters. You can even order by number to keep things real.

Service is friendly and very helpful when it comes time to making your selection. On my first visit I felt overwhelmed by the menu and was ask a few question to narrow down my choices. Nice!

Ordered the Adam Richman on Dutch Crumble Bread for my first experience. That Man vs Food fool is crazy. The sandwich was delicious and came with Avocado, Fried Chicken, Ham, Pesto, Real Honey and Swiss. Next visit tried out the Pat Tillman which is Beer Battered Mozzarella Sticks, Mushrooms and Roast Beef.

My co-worker went with the Gluten Free version of the Spiffy Tiffy. It comes with Avocado, Halal Chicken, Mushrooms, Pepper Jack, Pesto, and Provolone. She said it was spectacular and the first sandwich she has been able to eat in a long time. Regular bread makes her feel poorly and she could not stop talking about how good it tasted.

They also have some crazy BIG sandwiches like the Kryptonite. That one comes with Avocado, Bacon, Beer Battered Onion Rings, EXTRA Pepper Jack, Ham, Mozzarella Sticks, Pastrami, Pesto, Roast Beef, Salami, Stuffed Jalapeno Poppers and Turkey.

Too many choices to list them all. Check out their website and give them a visit. The prices are a little higher than your typical sandwich places but well worth it. You will definitely notice the difference in the higher quality of ingredients as well as the freshness of the product. SHOW ME THE LOVE!

5 STARS

We got our food to go and this place still has very good sandwiches. They did forget to include my French dressing on the side which hurt my ability to have a better sandwich. Otherwise, the onion rings were solid and large, the bag of chips was free with a check-in and since we arrived after 1pm, the wait for a sandwich was minimal. The only other issue is that there are some sandwiches on the printed menu that are not on the menu board which I discoved after I returned home.

Tried a new sandwich with good results - it was the Lynda Carter. I got the french dressing on the side. This one had baked breaded eggplant, avocado and gouda cheese with lettuce, onions and dirty sauce. All the flavors melded great and this sandwich was slightly healthier since it was not deep fried. It was about 10 bucks, but worthy of the price for once.

This place is still awesome.  Got sandwiches to go. 1. Going home for thanksgiving. .yum. 2. Chester the cheetah. .double yum. And 3. The damon bruce, since the husband must have steak
 
Service was fast and friendly,  easy to order. This place is classic!

Having read many great reviews, my wife and I were excited to try Ike's but we were seriously disappointed. The sandwiches, a Matt Cain and a Meatless Mike, were just OK. And,  the price was simply too high for what you get.  Two sandwiches, a side of Jalepeno poppers and one drink was $25. Setting cost aside, the sauces overwhelmed the rest of the sandwich. The bread is better than average, however, not stellar. While we would not say this is a place to avoid, many seem to like it, we would not put Ike's on our recommended list.  The local grown Sacks Art of Sandwicherie would have to be our pick to click in the greater Phoenix area.

I  got to know that this sandwich shop originally hailed from SF - and the only location so far is out in Mesa.

Have to say - the size of these sandwiches were monstrous! Putting two halves together is a size I can't fathom! $10 for a sandwich that big - seriously?!?! Awesome deal I think.

The sandwich itself? Quite good! The sandwich bread was "Dutch" so quite crunchy but tasty at the same time. Vegetarians - there is a whole section devoted for us on the menu!! 

The bear hug was supposed to have vegan breaded chicken as the patty but since they were out of stock, ended up getting vegan turkey. I didn't really mind if it was chicken or turkey because at the end the soy products end up tasting the same. Have nothing to compare it to!

None the less, the sandwich was delicious and I loved the touch of stuffed jalapeño poppers in the bear hug sandwich! Wow!

To finish every sandwich meal, they throw in a caramel apple lollipop - sweet end to a large meal!

Awesome to visit a place that doesn't just slap a wet roasted red pepper between to slices of bread and call it a day on their vegetarian menu development. Veg and vegan options are all superb and surprisingly filling.

Wife talked this place up! I would have gave 5 stars but for 2 things. The price was a little to high. But the sandwiches are very good. I can eat my fill. Even tho am only 163 pounds and 6 ft tall. This man needs food.! So when I go somewhere and spend money out and it be pricey I expect to get full. Not the case here. I ended up eating my whole sandwich and my wife felt so bad that she talked this place up and I was still hungry she gave me the other half of yours. So for the about of money spent and the amount of food. It's not worth. But the sandwiches are very good. So it's up to you!

THE. BREAD. 

This is legit the best sandwich shop. The menu is a mile long and they have vegan options! I love the variety and creativity in this place. I've tried the Kate Spade, the Pilgrim and a vegan buffalo chik'n sandwich (forgot the name) and all have delivered with flavor. The portions are massive and it's worth it. I'll admit it can get pricey but you're paying for fresh food that is made to order and it's sooooooo tasty. Invest in the best and especially a small business like this. I've never been disappointed and I actually crave this place. Never a wait, super fast service and really great food. Highly recommend.

These sandwiches are addicting. When I used to be a fast food eater I would always go to Carl's Jr and get a western chicken sandwich. The bbq chicken sandwich they offer here is like crack to me. The fact that they have a convenient open outdoor seating makes it a great stop during my dog walks as well. I never thought I could love a sandwich this much.
Delicious sandwiches! Love the vegetarian options!! Homemade bread is amazing too! Friendly staff, quick service.

I really can't add more than what others have said. My daugher suggested this place and swore it was great- and it was! Super delicious! I had a Kevin Bacon (BLT and pepper jack cheese) I added jalapenos and it was Wonderful!  I wasn't crazy about their fried zucchini- but everyone else liked it, so it must be me and I don't want to knock them on my taste preferences. We also got a drink and chips included in happy hour. Are they a little bit more for a sandwhich? Maybe a little but we would spend the same amount at Firehouse with chips and drinks, so its not outrageous. I would suggest going to the website first to browse the menu- there are a ton of sandwhiches and it could take awhile to decide.

Great food, absolutely terrible service. The first few times I had Ike's I would have given a 6-star rating if I could, but after my last two experiences here it will be a long time before I step inside these doors again.

Sandwich was slightly below average. The shops in California are 10x better. I can taste the West Coast Love that is put into every sandwich back in California, whereas in AZ, I can taste the Zona hate. The lettuce was soggy, bread wasn't well maintained (as it fell apart in my delicate hands). I am not happy with the sandwich but the service was great. Would not definitely come back here again!!!!

I was surprised that I hadn't written a review for this place.  I've been here at least a dozen times in the last year or so.

It's a great place, friendly staff, easy parking, convenient location, free refills on sodas.  I've really only had the Barry B which is a turkey/swiss/bacon sandwich because I ordered it the first time I came in and never changed.  

Their menu selection is just huge with lots of unique sandwiches.  Get the Dutch crunch bread with the crunchy, buttery top.  I think it's probably the best sandwich bread I've ever had.  Expect to pay about $10-$15 for a sandwich, chips and a drink.

Forgot to add:  I went in recently for their breakfast sandwiches.  Try The Hangover.  Eggs, your choice of meat, cheese, tater tots, and a really spicy hot sauce.

Great place and great food overall.

I usually don't hand out 5 starts but the sandwich was pretty damn good.  Really easy parking and access off the 60, friendly staff, massive menu, good seating, free refills, etc.

The bread I chose was the Dutch crunch which has a crunchy, buttery top that meshes well with the sandwich.  I chose the Barry B which has turkey, bacon, and Swiss cheese.  Really nice balance to everything.  The bread had a nice crunch on top but if soft on the inside so it doesn't feel hard.  

The sandwich and drink were $11 and change, plus I threw in a $1 tip.  I skipped the chips to save money and the sandwich was be enough to just eat half if you aren't very hungry.  I ended up eating the whole thing.

Like I said the menu is massive so you might want to take a look before going in there.  They also gave out a free caramel/apple sucker which was also damn good.

My Tips for you:
1. The menu can be overwhelming - ask the staff for recs.
2. If you aren't starving - split it with a friend, the portions are huge, that or do what I did and eat the whole thing, but just be in a food coma the rest of the afternoon 
3. Get dutch crunch for the bread. 
4. don't throw away your bag before checking to see if they didn't throw in some surprise lollipop inside, you'll be said when you've tossed yours and your friend's are enjoying their surprise candy dessert
Menu was amazing! So much to choose from. Food was pretty good but not great. I really liked the bread. I got the Pat Tillman. Again, pretty good. I'll go again but will order something else

My go-to sandwich place. My boyfriend and I come here at least once a week. I get the gluten free bread which is awesome, it's never made me sick. We actually met Ike a few weeks ago while he was there, super cool and nice guy. Stop by and try the Menage a Trois or Lizzy's Lips, my personal favorites!

Amazing sandwiches! The Dutch crunch bread is fantastic and the dirty sauce is too die for!! The halal chicken has great flavor! I tried the #98 with fried chicken and BBQ sauce and it was soooo good!!

I had first heard of Ike's while watching a Man vs Food episode and had been wanting to try it ever since. I even it had it bookmarked for my next visit to San Francisco. I'm so glad I don't have to wait to visit San Fran to try these delicious sandwiches, since they have recently expanded to Phoenix. My first time here was at Yelp Community Event, where we were able to have a tasting menu of 4 different sandwiches. This was perfect for first timers as there's so many options to choose from. I chose from an experimental tasting menu, and my husband had the spicy tasting menu, so we were able to taste 8 different sandwiches all together. Every sandwich we tried was delicious. It's really hard to pick a favorite, the highlights were a buffalo chicken style sandwich, the Mozzarella's Big Cheese which had chicken and honey on it, the Carne Asada fries sandwich (which included just that) and the dessert sandwich of nutella and marshmallow fluff. There's a ton of substitutions available along with vegetarian and vegan options, and their bread is fresh as it's par-baked daily and then baked to order. The staff here is really passionate about their food and extremely nice and helpful. I will definitely return for Ike's amazing sandwiches.

A vegan happy place. I've been here probably ten times, and have been entirely pleased by my experience each and every time. I work in service, so I know that good food takes time, and I have never been disappointed by customer service. I tend to bring friends here every time I go, and the cashiers are always SO understanding of their confusion! A couple of tips: if you're wanting to order your sandwich completely vegan, make sure you specify! They have vegan dirty sauce, but if you just order off the vegetarian menu, they'll give you the real mayo dirty sauce. The wheat bread also is not vegan. They use Daiya cheese, so if you're not a fan, just get it without. I have been so pleased with every sandwich I've tried. Can't wait to get back!

I usually get great service and great sandwiches from Ikes. Not so much the last time. I love Ikes so much that I ordered a meatless meatball sandwich to eat in and a meatless BLT sandwich to eat later. On my meatball sandwich to eat in I requested no lettuce or tomato. On my BLT sandwich to eat later I requested lettuce, tomato, and no Thunderbird sauce. When I got home, very excited to eat my BLT, I was pretty disappointed to find out that there was no L and there was no T.  But there was Thunderbird sauce. This is a testament to how much people listen anymore. The person heard the order for my first sandwich and assumed that it was the same exact order for my second sandwich, even though it was a completely different sandwich. Again, I usually love Ikes, but for $10 a sub I was pretty disappointed when I got home to find out that I only had a B, and not a BLT.

Ikes Ikes Ikes you make my day-ay. This is the third location that I've been to and I'm happy to say they're consistent with the food and great service. This location opened up two weeks ago and its kind of hidden. Its tucked in an area thats behind Mill Ave. It didn't take much time to find it, but I'm glad its hidden because only a few know about it so far. When you find it, the trip is totally worth it.

The first time I had Ikes was in downtown Oakland about a year ago. I have to say it was one of the most memorable sandwiches I ever had. I told everyone about the place as if I was the owner. I was working at a clinic about 5 miles away a few days ago, but had no idea that there was an Ikes Sandwich Shop in town. I'm never in this area because its been dead for years, but now I have reason to go there. I was planning on meeting my girlfriend at Chipotle for lunch. I pulled into the parking lot and saw Ikes off to the side. I was hyped!!! I immediately called her and told her to scratch Chipotle and do Ikes instead. We both got sandwiches and traded halves after I sampled hers. She ordered the gluten free bread and I have to say its the best I've had. The staff was excellent and made great recommendations. I will be back for sure.

These sandwiches are SO GOOD.  They are huge and savory and filling.  It is difficult to stop at eating "just half," for your tastebuds and tummy want the whole darn thing.  I ordered the Meatless Mike sandwich (vegan meatballs) and wow, those meatballs tasted better than "real" meatballs.  The bread was also great: fresh, soft where it had to be soft and just enough resistance in places to make you work for your food.  I also really liked the marinara sauce which is actually making my mouth water RIGHT NOW.  Some people may quibble about the slightly higher-than-expected sandwich prices (mine was $9.99 for something akin to a Subway footlong), but the quality of the ingredients, bread, and fantastic customer service are all worth the extra money.  You also get a caramel apple lollipop with your sandwich, which is da (sugar) bomb.  ;)  Check out Ike's for some serious sandwich magic.

I only discovered Ike's recently on Mill Ave and so far it's been a great spot for sandwiches. The location is somewhat hidden away behind the Bank of America ATM but I did a see a sign on Mill Ave to direct people there. I would have to agree with other people in that the sandwiches here are delicious! I'm not sure if I would consider them to be the best but they're definitely up there. So far I had the Menage A Trois and Steve Nash and they have been phenomenal. Somehow I'm not able to stray away from the Halal chicken just yet but the other sandwiches sound really good as well so I'll definitely have to give them a try sometime.

While I really enjoyed the sandwiches here and would give them an easy 5 star rating there are some minor issues about the restaurant. I just wish that the seating area was bigger and the tables that are used are just too small. In any case I will still come back here as the sandwiches are really good. Definitely one of the best spots on Mill Ave by far.

I typically loves ikes. But this was my first time at this location, not good at all. Two of the employees just sat on their phones while a huge group of customers walked in. Gentleman is at the counter asking where he can order and the employee has his phone in his hand looks at the customer and then looks back at his phone. The young girl behind the counter is on her phone at this point as well. Then a guy from the back had to run up and take the guys order while the two employees sat on their phone and ignored customers. There's now a line nearly to the door and still only 1 person ringing. Girl that was on her phone was also spending most of her time drawing a picture of Yoshi on the black board. We finally get our food 1 piece of the meal at a time, 1 sandwich every 10 minutes, we had to remind them of our onion rings order and when the young girl gave it to us she dropped it off nearly spilling the ranch dipping sauce across our table. Just not well run, staff is not trained well, and would seem like they don't take any pride in their jobs.

How can you not love a sandwich joint with fun names like Menage A Trois or the Stand By Me. This latest newcomer in Downtown Burbank apparently is catching on, judging by the crowd that began pouring in at lunchtime.  Started my first visit with the Marilyn Monroe, a generous portion of halal (shredded) chicken, honey mustard and pepper jack, served warm in their signature Dutch crunch (terrific) bread. My wife went veggie and tried the Jan Jan Jan, featuring breaded eggplant.  Another thumbs up.  Loved the colorful interior with a whimsical lunchbox decor. Can't wait to go back and try the Paul Reubens. You figure it out.
Cool,cool,cool. Crazy awesome sandwiches and atmosphere. Look at the menu ahead of time if you can.
The hype is real! Fantastic service (long haired dude was full of positive energy!), and the Elvis Kieth is insanely good. 5 easy stars!!

How have I never heard of this place before? I ordered this via Postmates because the descriptions of the sandwiches looked good. I am a vegetarian and I got a breakfast sandwich with the veggie bacon on it. WOW. This is the best sandwich I've eaten in a very long time! Excited to visit this place in person sometime!

The best sandwich shop I have ever been to! I look forward to coming to Mesa not because of the weather or the joy of the satellite office, but because of Ike's. I've tried the Thanksgiving, the Menage a Trois and the Spiffy Tiffy or something. Everything has been straight up delicious but the Menage a Trois definitely takes the cake. As if the sandwiches weren't good enough, the staff is SO friendly and they play 90s and early 00s tracks for a nostalgic trip down memory lane. WIN. WIN. WIN.

Just moved into a new neighborhood and used Yelp to find nearby restaurants. Ike's has 5 stars so I decided to try. 
I ordered the bear claw which sofa king yummy. Yummy yummy yummy. Staff was friendly and place was clean. Stoked it's so close to me, I'll definitely be going back for more!

Updated review because they refunded me and dealt with the issue thoroughly. Thanks for that!

Ordered Ike's from UberEats and the order was a DISASTER. They didn't give us the drink or chips we ordered. One sandwich was supposed to be turkey and cheese only and it came with lettuce, tomato, AND onion. Another sandwich was supposed to come with the roast beef and extra cheese on the side. Apparently, "they don't do that" so they charged us for the extra cheese and didn't give it to us and the sandwich just came minus the roast beef. We paid for about $10 worth of stuff that didn't even get to us.
This place continues to amaze me. Not your same ol sandwich shop. Packed with flavor! A little pricey but by far worth it.

This is the worst nasty expensive sandwich ever. 
I believe Ike's pay a service to give them a five star review when they open up at their stores. 
Too much dirty sauce on everything.

I'm originally from the Bay Area, where Ike's began. When I moved away, one of the things I thought I would miss the most is Ike's! Imagine my surprise when I found one right here, a close driving distance from my house. 

The best part is that they use real, San Francisco sourdough bread. It's amazing. One of the other things I miss from my home town is sourdough bread. It's fabulous to be able to satisfy my cravings here. 

Their sandwiches are wonderful. I've never been disappointed. The people who work here are also very nice. The other day, the nice man who works there brought my sandwiches to my car for because because my kids were asleep in the car. For anyone who has kids, you know what a big deal this is. 

I'm so happy to have an Ike's here! I'll continue eating here!

If you're willing to stand in line for an inordinate amount of time, and then wait an additional long time for your sandwich, you end up getting a better than average sandwich.  When I decided to save time and order by phone, I Googled their location but unfortunately the site defaults to the San Francisco location menu ( which is different from Mesa, AZ )  so that was a big fail.  When I called the Mesa store to see how I could view a menu online and phone it in, I was placed on hold for another longgggg period of time.  The guy who answered told me that I would just have to come to the store-  and apologized that there was no way to even view a menu from the Mesa location.  So , that ends my short relationship with Ike's.  Their culture conveys a "hipper than thou- you'll just have to wait & wait if you want one of these exclusive sandwiches"  attitude.  Is this a hot new nightclub, or a sandwich shop?  Are you kidding me?

What a delicious lunch spot!  I went with my sisters here to celebrate a birthday and we were thrilled with the experience!!!  We were greeted by one of the most friendly, knowledgeable employees named Melissa.  Right away she made us feel like family and had great recommendations from the plenteous sandwich options.  We requested to have our 3 sandwiches cut into thirds so we could sample a variety.   We literally couldn't decide which sandwich we liked the best as all of them were out-of-this-world scrumptious!  We tried the spiffy tiffy(chicken and pesto), the coming home for Thanksgiving (turkey, cranberry and Siracha) and Hollywood Cheese steak (ribeye and mushroom).  They were so moist and flavorful.  We will all definitely be back.

First time at Ike's. It's in downtown Tempe, near the movie theater.  Walked in 'solo' after Star Wars and we were the only party. 

There are dozens of sandwiches and combos. I ordered the MILF, adding fried chicken instead of halal chicken, on a Dutch crunch roll. Got a Thanksgiving on gluten free bread. for my beloved wife. 

Our dinner arrived in about six mins, hot and fresh. We didn't eat until we got home but it was still plenty warm. The bread was soft yet crusty on the outside and the fillings were plentiful. The poppers were a nice addition to the fried chicken. Loved my choice. My wife said she thought I had gotten her regular bread instead of GF cuz it was so yummy. 

I will be returning to Ike's, especially since learning about several locations throughout the valley.

Dutch Crunch Munch

Ikes is my favorite sandwich shops around The Valley. They really know how to make a sandwich; their Dutch Crunch bread is delicious and they really stack on meat. I have tried their Steve Nash, the Batman, and the Cain Velasquez, the Steve Nash being my favorite. The only thing I would suggest id to either split the sandwich or ask for less spread because their sandwiches can be very heavy.
VERY VERY good. I love this place. I was a virgin until this week. Great creative sandwiches and friendly staff. I had the the Bear Hug. It was amazing!

I have a problem giving a sandwich place five stars so Just consider this is rating sandwich place against other sandwich places. Decent atmosphere, friendly helpful staff, really well-made sandwiches. I've also read some of the other reviews and I would agree with all of the really good ones.  I don't agree with the ones that run the place or the food down. But it does go to show that nobody can guarantee that you will think this is five stars. Hope you at least give it a try it's worth it.

First time at this Ike's. Arrived at 11:45 for a Wednesday lunch and there were 8 in line in front of me. The line took 12 mins. 

I ordered the 504 Thunderbird which is only available in Mesa. It had pastrami, thunderbird sauce and smoked Gouda on a Dutch Crunch roll (my choice of five breads) for $9.99 plus tax. 

My lunch was ready in nine minutes because they make every sandwich to order. 

The bread was soft on the inside yet with a delicious crunch to the crust. The meat was plentiful and cooked properly.  The sauce was just the right touch: moist but not sloppy. 

The smoked Gouda was a very nice touch. Add in the fresh veggies and you've a winner.

The service was amazing from the second we walked in the door. The cashier was a sweet blonde girl who helped us with the daunting menu (there are just so many choices). I only eat gluten-free so it was nice to find a sandwich shop that had that option. The GF bread was one of the best I have had. It was also the same size as the regular sandwich which is not normally the case (most times it is much smaller). My sandwich was delicious (spiffy tiffy) and my fiancé loved his. They were very accommodating to food allergies and preferences allowing us to change or remove anything we wanted from the sandwiches on the menu. 

We stayed and are there in the fun atmosphere they created. The kitchen crew cheers for orders which was really fun. Then the tables were all brightly colored and each napkin holder had a different handwritten message on it. If you stay to eat in you get a free chips and drink as well. 

Overall this was a very good choice for dinner and I would definitely return.

Whaaaaaaat this place is amazing! We drove by several times wondering what it was, and after seeing the Yelp reviews decided to try it out. We split the vegetarian meatball sub and it was CRAZY. It tasted better than any other real meatball sub I've had. Everyone was very helpful and nice. Just plan on spending some time looking at the menu because there a lot of choices. Excited to go back!

We have quickly become regulars here due to their wealth of delicious vegan/vegetarian sandwiches. These sandwiches are the bomb. The staff here is very friendly and I think the prices are reasonable considering you're getting something super tasty. 
To people complaining about the prices: feel free to get your bland-a$$ 5 dollar foot long and leave all the tasty sandwiches for me:)

Food Poisoning Central!  I never get sick anywhere...my stomach is an iron trap.  But Ikes got me good with the halal chicken.  Something didnt taste quite right but it was my first time there so I just went with it.  After eating half a sandwich, I immediately  felt full...waaayyy too full.

Six hours later, I experienced the worst night of my life.  The next day wasn't so great either.
Needless to say I will NEVER eat Ike's Love sandwiches again. I wish I knew where else to report this.
The best sandwich shop I've ever been to. Highly recommend the Julius Caesar, on their signature bread. Just tremendous.

My first time in here and the cashier was so nice to help me out and pick what I wanted . I was debating between the MILF or the ménage e trois  and he said those were the 2nd and most popular menu items. But I choose to go with the ménage e trois with all the fixings and told him to hook it up with everything.  Literally the biggest sandwich ever and it was so good ! I had 2 of my coworkers take a bite and they were blown away too.  Totally obsessed and will be back !

I love this place so much. My office recently moved from Scottsdale to Mesa and ever since I discovered Ike's I've been eating there every week. My coworkers always get excited when it's Ike's Day. The chicken is fantastic and the sourdough bread is really nice and sour, which is strangely hard to find. My only complaint is that since I first started going there a few months ago, it seems like they put less meat on the sandwiches now so it's mostly bread. Very good bread, mind you, but I'd like  a little more meat without having to spend the $4 upcharge for extra.

This place rocks! a friend told me about it and she wasn't joking. it's Cheba Hut on steroids and I don't feel like a bad uncle bringing my niece in.  Try the "going home for thanksgiving."  Its awesome

Hated to give Ike's only 3 stars, but most times I go there they are out of their amazing Dutch Crunch bread. The other sandwich ingredients are great but so disappointing when you drive all the way there from N. Scottsdale and the bread is gone again. Time to move on and try some of the other local sandwich shops.

Really should be 3.5 stars. I was looking forward to going here after reading all the good reviews. I got a California something - BLT with avocado, dirty sauce, on Dutch Crunch. It was a huge sandwich - really like a double, so the price was right. The bread seemed almost stale and the sandwich was dry. The ingredients inside seemed fresh and they don't skimp. For that reason, I will give them another try with another sandwich and re-evaluate.
Best subs since Cheba Hut, pay a little more get a way more flavorful sub. By far the best sub sandwich place in AZ.

I tried this place in San Francisco, so couldn't have been happier when I discovered it here on a work trip! Absolutely delicious. They will make ones that they have at other locations too, so I got the Love Triangle (Menage A Trois with Vegan Breaded Chicken). Will be going back for more vegetarian sandwiches while I'm here!

It was definitely definitely delicious and the workers were friendly however, I over heard the table next to me getting there sand which with out ham when they ordered ham and I got my sandwich with ham when I ordered it with out . Not eating pig is a pretty big deal to me so I was just a bit disappointed the same mistake happened with two different customers in a matter of 5 minutes. Food is good and worth going back I just hope for the right order next time.

Awesome food, awesome ingredients. They have gluten-free bread, which is actually GOOD! Everything else tastes high quality.

The sandwiches do get a little sloppy, but it's because of all the ingredients packed into them. They are also a little expensive, but you get what you pay for so I can't really complain.

I've had this place a few times now, and its all been great. Definitely recommend this place to everyone.

Wow, . Eat one of the tastiest sandwiches I've ever had on that price level. The average sandwich which is huge costs between seven dollars and $10.  You walk in and there is a very very large board on the wall of every type of sandwich you can think of even vegetarian. If you don't see anything you want, they can make you what you want. The service staff are friendly and helpful and actually funny. The restaurant is clean and attractive and definitely for groups and families. But here's the deal the sandwiches are delicious the bread they use is different and they're very filling.  Ikes is located on the east side Alma School, south of Southern, across from Fiesta Mall. You will not be disappointed.

EVERYONE loves Ike's. It's amazing. I definitely recommend going with someone and splitting a sandwich since they can get slightly pricey, but these sandwiches are HUGE. I always get two meals out of it if I don't split with anyone.

1 Star because I came in at 10:45 AM and no one to be found.. I was even saying " hello" in a loud voice and no one responded.. and they had a really loud speaker playing music in the kitchen too.. 10 mins later two workers appears.. didn't even say sorry or anything.. first and last time here.. smoke break? Didn't even see them wash their hands.. thanks..

Husband wanted a basic turkey sandwich. They don't have plain mayo so he had dirty (garlic) aioli instead on the crunch bread. He also asked for cold. Turns out bread is half cooked so that when they make the sandwiches hit it cooks the rest of the way. It took a bit longer but he thought the crunch bread was very good. Turkey was high quality. 

I wanted to try the halal chicken on wheat but had trouble  find one that sounded good that wasn't sweet. I finally settled on the Elvis Keith(or something like that??). The chicken had a very good flavor and was obviously quality but didn't prefer the wasabi mayo flavor with it. I think I need to play around to figure out what works for me. 

Downgrade also was they had not made any iced tea that day. It was ready by the time our meal was almost over but a bummer for someone who doesn't drink soda. 

Upgrade is that Sunday's they have happy hour and you get free drinks and chips so at least I didn't pay for my drink. (You may need to ask for the happy hour special? It wasn't mentioned until I asked but maybe he would have?)

Worth trying again to see if I can find something spicy with the chicken that I like.

I truly could eat here every freaking day! No joke. 

It's about a 45 min drive each way for me but I would drive that way multiple times a day if it meant I could get another sandwich!  This place is truly amazing & I've already been there 2 times this week.

Visiting the first time I was really overwhelmed with all of the choices but the guy behind the counter kinda walked us through everything & helped us pick the perfect sandwich.  The workers talked to us like we were old friends.  I ordered The Change which was sliced ribeye, BBQ sauce, onion rings & gouda cheese.  I can honestly say it was one of the most amazing sandwiches I've ever had.  Ever.  They are pretty pricy but worth every penny. LOVE all the different choices they have, you can go the healthy route or you can just go crazy (like I did) & even add mozzarella cheese sticks to a sandwich!  

PLEASE OPEN ONE CLOSER TO ME! :(

My usual sandwich shop was closed for the holiday so I searched for a new place and found this. I was pleasantly surprised. The sandwiches are very big (I got it on Dutch crunch bread) and super good!! I will def be back to try other combinations. I got the soprano with no ham extra salami. It was delicious!! Love finding good sub shops!! Service was great as well!

I passed three sub shops to try Ike's out.  I was excited to try a local small shop sub.  Sadly I feel let down.  

The counter girl was very friendly.  A large selection of subs.  I got the Pee Wee..  Vegetarian turkey, coleslaw etc..  on their signature bread.  The sandwhich cost 9.50.  I thought, "this is going to be great!"  Umm. I wasn't  a fan of the bread.  Kinda day oldish to me.  I could have got over that, but the fact that my sandwitch tasted like lettuce, bread and a bit of a tang that reminded me of garlic.  I got one stinkin peice of faux turkey for over 9 bucks!?!  It could have been omitted and I wouldn't have noticed.  I was expecting more of a California club, or something along that line.  The sandwich is big.  I ate 1/2, but if it were good, I would have scarfed it all.  Sad...

I gave them a 3 cause the girl was so friendly.  
A 2 on the sub due to my value perception.
I actually thought as I was eating that maybe I got the wrong sub?

Hmmm. Update...  I think it was the wrong sub.  I didn't have any cheese on it.  The Pee Wee has Swiss...??    Epic Fail...

OUTSTANDING!  Ike knows how to make the perfect sandwich!  He also knows how to provide an outstanding experience to customers.  We went right before catching a show not far from here at the Mesa Amphitheater.  A big thank you to fellow yelpers for being so honest about just how AWESOME the food is.  We happen to go during happy hour and were surprised to find they do chips and drink as the "happy hour."  Very clever idea.  The menu is extensive so anyone you bring will be happy because it's a sure bet they will find something they enjoy.  Even if it isn't posted up on the menu (like what I said I wanted) they are sure to have it, and have a fun name for it.  They were quick with taking our order but the staff was friendly and unlike other places you may stop to grab a quick sandwich you could tell they actually ENJOYED being there.  I can't say how much it changes the experience when you go to a place like this when the people working there make you feel like they actually are happy to be there.  

The very best part was the advertisement for the happy hour had the coolest photo!  A funky feline helped sell the meal to us!  (See Photos) 

Thank you Ike's for not only an exceptional meal but an awesome experience!

OMG, this is the best gluten free sandwich I have ever had! Saw that they had GF bread and I just had to try it. Sandwiches are not normally something I get to have (celiac sucks), so when I can I love them. They had so many options - I really do recommend checking the website first and deciding what you want. It took us a long time looking at the board to choose. The space is very small - definitely better for take out (they also deliver which is nice). Our cashier was very helpful in assisting us in our sandwich choice. Turns out he was celiac too, so I was comfortable with his assurances that cross contamination with normal bread is minimal (and I didn't get sick - huge bonus!). We will definitely be back here, and often!

Nom Nom Nom Nom!  Everything I have tried here has been delicious so you can't really go wrong with any selection.  

I suggest the Dutch crunch bread. I think it really makes the sandwiches something different. My favorite is the Count of Monte Chase-O.

If you are going during lunch time allot extra time in your schedule.  It gets packed and it will take you forever to get your order.

Horrible! None of our sandwiches were done correctly. I specifically asked for no mayo on mine and the sandwich for my kids. Mine came with mayo and I didn't think to check my daughters. I'm glad she refused to eat it because she would have gone into anaphylactic shock had she eaten it because they put mayo on it which has egg and she is very allergic to.  They re-made my sandwich but got it wrong again. I'm now back in Phoenix with two sandwiches we won't eat and $20 down the drain.

Really really good. I got the pesto chicken sandwich protein style and it was delicious. Lots of lettuce and the sandwich was huge. They literally make any sandwich under the sun. You'll definitely find something you like here. It's a little hard to find and off the road, under some staircases, but it's a nice gem that you'll find yourself coming back to again and again!
The best sandwich shop around. I love a good sandwich and it does not get better than the Thunderbird with Dutch Crunch bread. If you like your food a lil spicy try it and you'll be plenty happy.

First time here, heard good things. Was not disappointed.

Don't be discouraged by the seemingly high prices, one sandwich is easily two meals. I had the Lynda Carter; breaded eggplant with melty gouda, fresh avocado, and thousand island dressing. Topped off with lettuce, tomato, and (free) red onions. Seriously, one half of this deliciousness more than filled me up for lunch.

Lots of vegetarian options and lots of additions/substitutions. Bright and friendly establishment with helpful staff. A must-try for the Tempe sandwich-eater.

On May 10th Marc Community Resources had Ike's cater a lunch for a Mesa Chamber Safety Committee Meeting. We were thrilled with the service (including their delivery and setting up). The food was sensational and it included vegan choices that were well received.
For your next event, consider using Ike's. We know we will!
The only reason the did get that star was because the sandwich taste good.  To much breath not enough meat, and over priced sandwiches.  Go to Lennys it's better in every way.

Had my first encounter with Ike's yesterday and what a tasty one of was! Warm tomato, garlicky pesto, flavorful turkey on soft yet crunchy bread.  Thanks for the excellent customer service too.  Stephan Jenkins, you rock! I'll be checking out some of your friends next....

This sandwich shop is beyond eccentric and also...delicious. I came here on a short lunch break from asu, and while there is plenty of seating outside, only a few tables indoors. The sandwich menu is crazy, and I love the references to pop culture. I can't get enough of this place. Those chips? Amazing!!!
My sandwich was sooo good but the guy there creeped me out so much idk if I can ever go back

I'll be back at Ike's for sure. This was my first time, and I tried one of their recommendations, the MILF sandwich. It was truly a unique sandwich. The spice level was just right, and combination of the meat and sauces was perfect. The size of most sandwiches here is around 8", and they can serve them in a wide variety of breads. The only problem that one may face at this location is the parking, it may be a challenge on a weekend evening during the busy times at Mill Ave. Highly recommended place, and I'll definitely be back to try many more sandwiches here!

Wow! Has the chicken w provolone n honey mustard. Incredibly good. The menu is huge. Vegetarians n vegans will have plenty of choices too along with us carnivores.  S. F. restaurant w fresh baked bread. Can't wait to go back. The staff is very friendly.

Wow. Since discovering this place I have been back about 5 times. One of the best sandwich places I've been too. I don't want to hype it up too much, because you should discover this place for yourself.

My favorite is the Ménage a Trois.

Excellent! 3rd Ike's location I have been to and this one was up to par with the San Francisco location. I ordered the Bella and it was great! Staff was very friendly and the place was clean. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a bomb sandwich!

I'm in the area on a business trip and decided to visit this spot for lunch. I ordered the mozerralla's cheese ( can't remember the actual name) but it was good. On the cashiers recommendation I exchanged the shredded chicken for fried chicken. The sandwich also had honey, honey mustard, and 2 types of cheese. It was very tasty. 


The service is also very good. The staff is friendly and patient with new customers who maybe overwhelmed by the size of the menu.

If you are in the Mesa area, try this place out for lunch.

I love Ike's as they have a ton of vegan options and I really like that you can bring in your own cup for soft drinks or tea as I hate using styrofoam that is thrown away and adding more to the landfill.  Great food.  All the bread is vegan.  Really great air fries.

I came to Ike's today because my parents wanted their favorite sandwich. I have to be gluten free...so I always discuss with the staff prior to ordering to ensure I will not be glutened. The manager stepped in and we discussed my needs. Then she took it upon herself to make me a sandwich and accommodate me...I left with 3 Tony Soprano sandwiches. Mine was prepared with the best care to prevent cross contamination and for this I am thankful. Their gluten free bread is good and the sandwich was great! 
Thank you, thank you for taking care of me today. You went above and beyond. 
Highly recommend this restaurant!!!
We are absolutely OBSESSED with this place. It's honestly one of the best sandwich places I have ever been to. The quality and combination of their ingredients make it simply amazing!

Can I just say this place is DELICIOUS!!!!! The staff is so awesome and fun as well :) Also if you're vegan please try the Pirates of the Carribean it's amazing... Please try it and for you vegetarians you can definitely enjoy some delights as well. Something for everyone!!!! YAY!!!!!!
This place is the BEST!!!!!! I have no complaints about the food but I wish their website worked a little better.

I usually don't like sandwiches. I also do not like things that are priced higher than they need to be. But some how Ike's manages to overcome my biases and eek out a good scoring review.

The main reason I am a "fan" is due to the large vegetarian options and are more than a salad on bread or cheese on bread sandwich. I also apreicate having a unique dutch bread option and the free candy apple lolly at the end.

I have tried two subs, the first was the vegetarian meatball sub. It had fake meat some kind of creamy sauce and lettuce, it worked, for $10 I then had to go back to work.

I also tried the pilgrim which had tofurkey and cranberry sauce. Again the mix of flavors and textures worked.

They have some impressive sounding sides, but due to the prices they do not seem to get ordered much.

Placed an order for 1 sandwich over the phone to pick up. I did this because I've heard there can be long waits and I had alot to do at work. The person I spoke with was very pleasant despite sounding busy (the only reason they have 2 stars instead of 1) and he provided a time to pick up of 25 minutes. Understanding that they were busy, I was completely ok with this. Arrived at Ike's a few minutes after the time given over the phone, there was a huge line almost out the door. The cashier took my money pretty quick but when he went to check on my sandwich, it wasn't done and I was told it would be"just a bit." Seeing I was a bit irritated, the cashier said "we are really busy but we'll throw in some coupons." Oh how nice of them... Why did I even bother to call it in? They had more than 25 minutes from the time I called to the time I arrived (I got there a few minutes later than the time they told me it would be ready) to make 1 sandwich and it still wasn't ready which is completely unacceptable when their website touts calling in your order. I sat waiting for my sandwich for another 15 minutes all the while watching them get orders out to other people who had been in the line when I arrived. The kitchen's priorities just seem to be out of whack and the cashier should have urged the kitchen to make my order a priority since it was supposed to be ready when I got there. When my order was ready, the cashier gave me a drink cup at no charge but after filling it, I realized there were no lids at the counter... just one more thing I had to wait for. The cashier made the comment that I just really wasn't having a good time there and I said that it was making me think I don't ever want to go back and mentioned that it took too long. The cashier was very apologetic and while I cannot fault him entirely for the issues, I do think there was more he could have done to get my order out  quicker. Additionally, those coupons that he offered were not given. Initially, I was willing to change my rating for Ikes if the sandwich turned out to be really good... it was simply ok and not worth waiting over 40 minutes for. It also had a ton of garlic in it. Don't get me wrong, I love garlic but this was kind of overkill. Needless to say, I will not be back.

Put the Matt Cain in your mouth. Dutch crunch bread. Trust me.  Put the thunderbird in your mouth. Dutch crunch bread. Listen to me. I love Ike's. I love that love and sandwiches from the bay have made it to Arizona. The service is always good. You could easily share a sandwich with someone because they're big. But why would you want to? When you can save the other half for later? They can be a bit messy to eat. But that's what napkins and washing your hands are for. So good. Also, you get a Carmel apple sucker with your meal. Delightful. Ooooh, and try the voodoo chips. Put Ike's in your mouth.

I've finally tried Ike's & I agree with the hype! I'm definitely a fan! 

I have been eyeing this place for quite a while but am 1) hardly in this area 2) if I am in this vicinity, it's hard to steer the BF away from Cheba Hut...but finally, I found myself driving up Alma School yesterday, BF-less, scoping out a place to grab lunch & decided on Ike's. 

Upon first glance, I was in a bit of sticker shock with their sandwiches in the $10 price range. But since I was already inside the store, they already had my complete buy in. The menu is very extensive which I liked because I love given variety. But since this is my first visit I thought I'd start with a simpler sandwich and opt to be daring on my next trip (if there is a next trip). I went with the Bella on Dutch Crunch Bread - Yelp's review highlights helped me decide. Although the gentlemen behind the register was very helpful with suggestions. 

While waiting, I heard a man at a nearby table ask one of the ladies to wrap up his other half of the sandwich to go because it was too large and he couldn't finish it. Okay, he was a pretty large fellow who I would assume could finish a whole sandwich for lunch (Yes, I totally judge him. Sorry, not sorry) so I began to wonder just how large these sandwiches really were. 5 minutes later, I received a brown bag to go with a ginormous sandwich! It was huge! Suitable for 2 people and totally justified the $10 price tag.

I was only able to finish half. The bread was nice and toasty. The chicken was thinly sliced and lightly dressed with honey mustard. The creamy avocado went perfectly with it. I saved half for the BF and he ate it this morning - heated up in the toaster oven to get the bread crispy again. We both liked it a lot. He said it was really good and that he wouldn't turn down my suggestions for Ike's next time!
Found on yelp leaving back to California! Was great food I got the SunDevil and it was great! They have lots to chose from!

I went tonight for the first time and it just so happened to be this location's one year anniversary. To celebrate, they gave away free subs with a check in (score!). Due to this, there was a pretty crazy line, but it was well worth the wait.

The staff was really nice! They were patient with questions and even rewrapped subs when we didn't finish. The man himself Ike was there and he was so friendly! Even though busy, he chatted with us for a bit, telling us his favorites.

Drawn to the uniqueness, I got the Bear Hug. It was so yummy! Just the right amount of spice and creaminess. I would definitely recommend it, but with so many options, you can't go wrong!

Parking is always a drag on Mill, but there is also a location nearby in Mesa for those wanting to avoid this.

I was pleasantly surprised to see that the line wasn't out the door and around the corner, unlike the original Ike's location that I've frequented for the last ten years in San Francisco. I also loved that they've kept the menu consistent with the SF location, which made me a little homesick in a good way.

The service was friendly and quick, however, I had gotten my sandwich to-go and didn't open it until I got back to the office. I was heartbroken to see they had forgotten to put the BBQ sauce on my Menage A Trois :( Our office was 15min away so I couldn't go back to correct it. The sandwich was unfortunately pretty bland without that BBQ punch I had been anticipating.

Ordered food to pick up for my staff and they told me it would be ready in 15 minutes. Got there 20 minutes later and the sandwiches weren't ready. I sat around for another 20 minutes before I finally received it. When I asked why even order ahead the the person who said he was the manager told me "yea right" and walked away. Food might be good but their customer service  and attitude was horrible. Our office will never be back.

As far as a sandwich shop this is probably the best I've ever had The staff is extremely friendly. The food was quick in arriving at our table.  We just tried it because it was close to our hotel. Make sure you come here if you ever get a chance.

Great sandwich place that's tucked away on Mill Ave! With unique menu items, there is definitely something for everyone. They even have sandwiches that include mozzarella cheese sticks layered right in! I'm a big fan of their 'normal' turkey, bacon and swiss or tuna sandwiches. The Sun Devil sauce is amazing and be sure to take advantage of the free extra add in's i.e. onion, mustard, etc. I personally order my sandwich on the sourdough, but I've heard good things about the Dutch crunch along with their normal wheat and white. I had to deduct a star because it's really hard find a parking spot in the area without having to pay to park.

Ordered the pastrami on house bread. They had way too much on this sandwich to taste the pastrami.  The house  bread  tastes like saltine crackers on top.  Would try this place again has a ton of selection. Also they don't have ice tea . Seating was kind of limited so it if hot outside might want to take it to go.

Love the veggie sandwiches and the dutch crunch bread. A bit overpriced but the sandwiches are huge. They did miss a couple of ingredients on my sandwich a couple of times, like the habanero salsa. I just hope the place survives unlike all the previous establishments in this location.

The best place for delicious subs. Their menu is huge and I appreciate all of the vegan options. The crunch bread is the best! Portion sizes are huge. I highly recommend if you're in the mood for a big hearty sandwich.

I would come back to Ike's because my sandwich was quite tasty. I was expecting the roast beef to be cold but it must be because I'm from the East Coast. But no matter, it was still very tasty.  I ordered int on their signature bread, which was delicious.  My only wish was that my sandwich be a little bigger for what I paid.  Service was good. Place was clean. I would go back while in the Tempe area.

Tried this place since it was on my way to the hotel. They are brand new to Mesa. They have an impressive list of sandwiches. They have a lo g list of veggie sandwiches, if that is your preference.I ordered the "Michael Jordan" - a meatball sandwich. It was outstanding! One of the best meatball sandos I have had. The place itself is bright, clean and welcoming. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would certainly go again, and I highly recommend the place.

Someone just brought in a tray of sandwiches from ike's and I'm in love! The bread looked heavenly but I skipped the bread and ate the insides of what I believe were the "sometimes I'm a vegetarian" & "Reggie Jackson" & I'm definitely adding this spot to my regular lunch list!
Sandwiches over priced and what sandwich place doesn't have mayo only something called dirty sauce.  Waste of time and money.....

Delicious! Don't trust google map! I walked mills up and down 3 times trying to find this fucking place! It's at the back of the building...yes I am an idiot. Anyway, service was great and the sandwich was delicious!!! I will definitely go back to try another. 

I like warm sandwiches and when the cashier said all their sandwiches comes warm, I was sold! Lol
So yea, if you like freshness and warmth, this place is for u!!

Pretty incredible selection and menu item for vegeterians.  A solid 1/3 to 1/2 of the menu is geared for vegans / vegeterians.  With all kinds of awesome options like vegeterian meatballs to orange (fake) chicken sandwiches.   This is a place where really, the sky is the limit with your sandwich.  Gone are the days of ordering a salad between two slices of bread.  REAL food :)

That said, I only have 1 nit.  The sauces can be a little excessive in terms of calories and quantity (they do warn you... they're messy sandwiches).  That's really my only complaint.  That I can't come here every day or I'd blimp up even more than I already am.  They're that good, and that heavy!

Work some what in the area and it was my 1st time I had a sammy from this location and it was good. Adam Richman on Dutch crunch... Good size sandwich and taste was on point. Ikes has yet to let me down. Make sure to check their menu at all locations. Just because it's not on the board.. doesn't mean it can't happen
This place is kinda pricey for a sandwich but I give them 5 stars because the food is yummy!!
Whole family LOVES their sandwhiches! Great variety! They actually have a whopping 700 sandwhiches!! Fries are AMAZING! Come and get your sandwhich fix here once in a while! Great place!

Firstly, the number of sandwiches available is crazy! Having never been to this restaurant before, I was slightly overwhelmed by all the options. However, employees were very willing to offer suggestions and answer any questions I had. They offered a bunch of super cool combinations. I ended up ordering the MC Hammer which was delicious! The sandwich was big enough that I ate half, plus some fries, and was satisfied. The air-fried fries were delicious!!!!! They were probably my favorite part of the meal. I was, however, very disappointed by the jalapeño bites. In particular, because of the price. My friends and I paid $3.50 for this appetizer to share, and there were 4 jalapeño poppers. That seems a bit over priced for sure and to be honest, they weren't very good. That was the only disappointing part of my experience, and it's why I gave the restaurant 4 stars.

I give four stars only because i said specifically "no cheese" and when i was about half way done with the first half of my XXXtina the sammy fell apart and i realized it was cheesy.  i don't even want to attempt to finish the second half.  

my employer has ordered from here before and everything was delicious so i know they have amazing food.  i'm just disappointed that my order wasn't made as i requested.  

i'll give them another chance probably, once i get the slimy cheesy taste out of my mouth.

Stopped in after checking this place out online and saw they had a lot of vegetarian options. When I got there I was totally overwhelmed with all the options so I just went to the counter, told them what I was looking for, and the found the exact sandwich I wanted. It happened to be on a menu from one of their other locations, but they are able to make just about anything you could want. As a vegetarian, it's difficult to find any place that's overwhelming with veggie options, so this was honestly a breath of fresh air. I initially thought it was a little bit pricey, but once I got the sandwich and saw just how big it was, the price definitely seemed fair. So my only advice would be to only go when you're really hungry, 'cause you're about to get more food than you can handle.

I'll be back next time I'm around Mill!

Get the Dutch Crunch bread--you will thank me. 
I had the Count of Monte Chase-o (Ham, Strawberry Preserves, Swiss, Turkey) with onions peppers, dirty sauce lettuce and tomatoes. Now, I was nervous about this complex of a sandwich with strawberry preserves, but oddly enough it works. It was a little over $8 for a huge, filling sandwich with the best flavors and textures I have ever had in a single sandwich. My tastebuds are still dancing.

This is a San Francisco chain and it shows with enough "LOVE" stuff around to make me feel like I should have flowers in my hair and break out my old "granny skirt" from 1969. There are both booths and tables and chairs. The restaurant looks clean with ample parking right at the door. The employees are friendly and willing to take the time to explain this very complex, diverse menu. 

Without a doubt this is the best sandwich shop I have ever been to.

I had absolutely been craving Ike's for days, and had been wanting to introduce my boyfriend to it as well. When I had finally found myself in the area (as this location is the most convenient for me) I stopped in to place a to go order.

I'm currently sitting here writing this and I will say that the service has been good, and the staff member who helped me was very nice and apologetic, but I was heartbroken to not only find they were out of the Dutch crunch bread, but also the jalapeño poppers. Two popular items on the menu. Both of which I was looking forward to enjoying this evening. 

I'm sure the sandwiches will be fine, but it doesn't feel the same.

After sampling Ike's sandwiches at different events, I decided to give the shop a try. I am torn on my review. The food quality, while messy, was very good, but the service was below average.

I got in line behind three people. It did not take long for someone to take my order, but it did take almost 20 minutes to deliver my sandwich. I only had 30 minutes for lunch, so this left me pressed for time. They only had one person running orders from the kitchen, and he was also the only one running the cash register. It was very inefficient. 

I think I will skip returning to this location. Especially during the lunch hour.

Also, they were out of bacon. What kind of sandwich/breakfast so runs out of bacon before noon?!

Holy sandwich menu, Batman!! That was the best meatball sub EVER (called the Micheal Jordan for a good reason)!! The Boy got the Handsome Owl and it was a delicious vegetarian sandwich I'd consider getting my meat-loving self if I weren't worried about missing out on the meatballs!! The Dutch Crunch bread our sandwiches came on was super tasty with plenty of crunch AND soft chewiness. They even let me put the fried zucchini ON my sandwich instead of on the side!! These are the kind of sandwiches that are so tasty, you feel like you have to eat every bite - even if there's no room in your stomach.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful when choosing from the huge list of choices. It was a fun place to be and their Happy Hour special for people eating there was a free drink and chips with your sandwich!! Even the music playing was great (old school R&B/rap...the fun stuff everyone loves to sing along with)! I can't wait till one opens in Phoenix. Hey Ike!! There's an old JB's that's closed on the corner of 32nd St. and Indian School - how about opening up shop there?!?!? I promise to bring all my friends!!
The sandwiches were really good, but for two sandwiches, two bags of chips and two drinks, $30 is a little much. Also, the time it took to get the food was a little long.
Can I just copy/paste my review from the Mesa location? There's nothing really more to say than this place is amazing! Thank you so much for introducing me to this place, Chase!

THANK YOU CHASE for introducing me to Ike's sandwiches!!! This place is seriously amazing! I don't even know the words to describe it's awesomeness. I'm sorry to say that it took me a good couple of months to finally go try a sandwich here once Chase suggested that I try it. I figured it was just another regular sandwich place like Subway, Quiznos or Jimmy John's... however, this is anything but like those places! There are hundreds of different sandwiches to choose from, it's almost overwhelming to take in. 

It was seriously SO AMAZING, that I went twice in one day!

I don't know how else to say this, but Ike's sandwiches surpass any sandwich I've ever had. When you go, you NEED to try the Menage a Trois sandwich. The description didn't blow me away... but once you taste it, oh.my.goodness!!! AMAZING! Thanks again Chase, Ike's is now a favorite! I can't wait for the Tempe location to open! :D:D

Busy place, appears clean, staff friendly.  Asked for salt and was told I wouldn't need it and they had none, no pepper either.  I needed both it turns out.  Ordered 2 sandwiches and a side of fried onion rings.  The rings were too with breading and desperately needed salt but the ketchup had to do.  Had their Hollywoods SF Cheesesteak #2, the mushrooms were cold and tasteless, had tons of shredded lettuce, some tomato, lots of a mayo tasting sauce and I wasn't crazy about the dutch crunch bread, crunchy yes, flavor little and dry.  My wife said she liked the bread on her Bear Hug #444 (Bacon, extra dirty sauce, Mushrooms, Stuffed Jalapeno Poppers, Thinly Sliced Rib Eye Steak). She thought they deserved 3 stars and I thought 2 stars so I guess it will be 2 1/2 stars total.  I also thought it was too bad that they had no tea and their root beer was overly sweet.
